Text: It acts as a quick-trigger and is a perilous, destabilizing tool.
examples: It puts a hair-trigger, and it is a dangerous, destabilizing weapon.

Text: These are the inquiries that people from the North, South, East, and West have a right to understand.
examples: These are the questions in these areas that the North and South, East and West are entitled to know.

Text: Trust me, we employ diplomacy whenever possible.
examples: So we use diplomacy every chance we get, believe me.

Text: Assistance is required; it needs to be corrected.
examples: It has to be helped, has to be fixed.

Text: Our nation is not experiencing a downfall.
examples: We are not a nation in decline.

Text: All verifiable systems should be considered for negotiation toward an agreement.
examples: Every system that is verifiable should be placed on the table for negotiations for an agreement.

Text: I've encountered parents who acquired the courage online to equip their children.
examples: I've met parents who've on the Internet gotten the armor to send their kids.

Text: Donald Trump operates like a small business.
examples: Donald Trump is a small business.

Text: Another approach is to encourage our seniors to enroll in these drug discount programs, which are proving effective.
examples: Another is to pass -- to get our seniors to sign up to these drug discount cards, and they're working.

Text: Returning to personal differences, Jim, could you be more detailed? I believe the President could clear up the question of pardons this evening.
examples: Getting back to personal differences, I think, Jim, if you are a little more specific, but I think the President could clarify one thing tonight and that's the question of pardons.

Text: Similar to Mr. Perot, I'm worried about the deficits. While $150 billion is a massive sum, it's very challenging to claim we'll spend more when we're trying to reduce the deficit.
examples: Like Mr. Perot, I am concerned about the deficits and $150 billion is a lot of money, but it's awful hard to say we're going to go out and spend more money when we're trying to get the deficit down.

Text: I definitely won't promise him more flexibility after the election.
examples: And I'm certainly not going to say to him, I'll give you more flexibility after the election.

Text: Without managing the health care costs of the whole system, it is impossible to gain control over it.
examples: If you don't control the health care costs of the entire system, you cannot get control of it.

Text: Consider this: when you think about it, the No Child Left Behind Act is essentially a jobs act.
examples: Listen, the No Child Left Behind Act is really a jobs act when you think about it.

Text: After hearing both perspectives, I believe that if they engaged in conversation instead of hurling insults, we'd achieve much more.
examples: Well, I've listened to both sides, and if they would talk to one another instead of throwing rocks, I think we could get a lot done.

Text: I am convinced of the necessity for an education system that begins with preschool and continues through college.
examples: I feel strongly that we have to have an education system that starts with preschool and goes through college.

Text: I think the Vice President mentioned two or three times that I leaned towards the left.
examples: I guess the Vice President two or three times, said I was coming from the left.

Text: I am firmly convinced that one must have the courage to stand and fight, regardless of the formidable forces opposing them.
examples: I believe very deeply that you have to be willing to stand up and fight no matter what powerful forces might be on the other side.

Text: Just take a look at those young kids, and if anyone even considers making drugs legal, they've lost my support.
examples: Just look at those little children, and if anybody can even think about legalizing drugs, they've lost me.

Text: I envision a future with global harmony, where the USA champions the principles of democracy, human rights, and liberty worldwide.
examples: I see a future when the world is at peace, with the United States of America promoting the values of democracy and human rights and freedom all around the world.

Text: I don't subscribe to the vice president's belief in a massive government.
examples: I don't believe, like the vice president does, in huge government.

Text: In November of 1975, I convened with leaders of the five major industrial countries in France to explore how we could collectively address the impending recession challenges.
examples: In uh - November of 1975 I met with the leaders of the five industrial nations in France for the purpose of seeing what we could do acting together to meet the problems of uh - the coming recession.

Text: I believe the American people have a single - uh expectation - that the details about Mayaguez are presented to them accurately and thoroughly.
examples: I think the American people have only one - uh requirement - that the facts about Mayaguez be given to them accurately and completely.

Text: I'm not claiming it's going to happen, yet we should at least consider it.
examples: I'm not suggesting it will be done, but at least we ought to look at it.

Text: In my opinion, the foremost duty of the U.S. President is ensuring the safety of the American citizens.
examples: Look, this, in my view, is the highest responsibility of the President of the United States, which is to maintain the safety of the American people.

Text: Subsequently, we observed there were multiple items sharing that identical serial number.
examples: And then we noticed that there was more than one with that same serial number.

Text: Like Governor Reagan, I wish to pledge a tax reduction to the American public while standing here.
examples: I would like to stand here and promise the American people a tax cut, as Governor Reagan has done.

Text: Our nation's team present over there performed excellently.
examples: And our team of -- our country's team over there did a great job.

Text: In what ways can we ensure the safety and protection of our citizens?
examples: How do we protect our people?

Text: My expectation is that the Senate will fulfill its duty and approve President Obama's nominee they've received.
examples: I would hope that the Senate would do its job and confirm the nominee that President Obama has sent to them.

Text: Oscar, the issue of how the federal government should curb young people's access to tobacco marks a significant distinction between myself and Senator Dole.
examples: Oscar, the question of what the federal government should do to limit the access of tobacco to young people is one of the biggest differences between Senator Dole and me.

Text: We have not established a regulatory framework suited to 21st-century challenges to address these issues.
examples: We did not set up a 21st-century regulatory framework to deal with these problems.

Text: Thus, we're now aware of Donald's thoughts, words, and behavior concerning women.
examples: So we now know what Donald thinks and what he says and how he acts toward women.

Text: And that's exactly what we're doing.
examples: And we're doing just that.

Text: They understand the experience of lacking family leave or childcare.
examples: They know what it's like not to have family leave or childcare.

Text: Involve those who may not be politically inclined but grasp the issue, and allow them to advise Congress.
examples: Get people who don't have any interest in politics but understand the issue and let them make the recommendation to Congress.

Text: Nobody else shares that belief.
examples: No one else believes that's the case.

Text: Our nation is enduring hardship due to poor decisions by individuals like Secretary Clinton regarding our employment and current events.
examples: Our country is suffering because people like Secretary Clinton have made such bad decisions in terms of our jobs and in terms of what's going on.

Text: Such innovations could transform American education and elevate us economically.
examples: Those things would revolutionize American education and take us to the top economically.

Text: However, I am convinced that we need to explore future energy sources, such as wind, solar, and biofuels, and invest in them.
examples: But I also believe that we've got to look at the energy sources of the future, like wind and solar and biofuels, and make those investments.

Text: However, if private voucher schemes are to be implemented, they should be decided by the states in regions where the majority of funds are generated and allocated.
examples: But if you're going to have a private voucher plan, that ought to be determined by states in localities where they're raising and spending most of the money.

Text: I must say that I see things differently.
examples: Well, I have a different view.

Text: To be honest, I believe that Senator McCain and I largely concur on these topics.
examples: No, actually, I think Senator McCain and I agree for the most part on these issues.

Text: Initially, let me clarify a previous statement that under my agricultural plan, food prices would rise by twenty-five percent.
examples: Well first may I correct a statement which was made before, that under my agricultural program food prices would go up twenty-five percent.

Text: We're planning to achieve this by directing funds towards prevention initiatives.
examples: And we're going to do it by investing in prevention.

Text: They posed a technical inquiry to me.
examples: I was asked a technical question.

Text: The world benefits from his absence in leadership.
examples: And the world is better off without him in power.

Text: We've been acquainted for 35 years.
examples: I've known him for 35 years.

Text: Now, we are aware of Donald's thoughts, words, and behavior towards women.
examples: So we now know what Donald thinks and what he says and how he acts toward women.

Text: Like Governor Reagan, I wish to assure the American public of a tax reduction.
examples: I would like to stand here and promise the American people a tax cut, as Governor Reagan has done.

Text: While I do not imply that it will happen, it is something we should consider.
examples: I'm not suggesting it will be done, but at least we ought to look at it.

Text: I was taken aback by how vast it was.
examples: And I was surprised at the extent of it.

Text: These are the inquiries that people from North, South, East, and West deserve answers to.
examples: These are the questions in these areas that the North and South, East and West are entitled to know.

Text: Without managing the health care expenses across the whole system, gaining command over it is impossible.
examples: If you don't control the health care costs of the entire system, you cannot get control of it.

Text: The Vice President remarked, perhaps twice or thrice, that I was approaching from a left-leaning stance.
examples: I guess the Vice President two or three times, said I was coming from the left.

Text: Unlike the Vice President, I don't endorse the idea of a massive government.
examples: I don't believe, like the vice president does, in huge government.

Text: Consider this: the No Child Left Behind Act essentially functions as a jobs act.
examples: Listen, the No Child Left Behind Act is really a jobs act when you think about it.

Text: I believe the American public has just one expectation—that the details surrounding Mayaguez are presented to them with accuracy and thoroughness.
examples: I think the American people have only one - uh requirement - that the facts about Mayaguez be given to them accurately and completely.

Text: I've encountered parents who found the courage online to encourage their children to pursue new paths.
examples: I've met parents who've on the Internet gotten the armor to send their kids.

Text: Believe me when I say, we seize every opportunity for diplomacy.
examples: So we use diplomacy every chance we get, believe me.

Text: What measures can we take to safeguard our citizens?

Text: Additionally, I am convinced that we need to focus on future energy sources such as wind, solar, and biofuels and invest in them.
examples: But I also believe that we've got to look at the energy sources of the future, like wind and solar and biofuels, and make those investments.

Text: Our nation is not experiencing a downturn.
examples: We are not a nation in decline.

Text: In November 1975, I convened with the leaders of five industrialized nations in France to discuss collective strategies to tackle the looming recession.
examples: In uh - November of 1975 I met with the leaders of the five industrial nations in France for the purpose of seeing what we could do acting together to meet the problems of uh - the coming recession.

Text: It's a precarious, destabilizing weapon, just like a hair-trigger.
examples: It puts a hair-trigger, and it is a dangerous, destabilizing weapon.

examples: And our team of -- our country's team over there did a great job.

examples: I was asked a technical question.

examples: Get people who don't have any interest in politics but understand the issue and let them make the recommendation to Congress.

Text: Just take a look at those young kids, and if anyone is still considering making drugs legal, they won't have my support.
examples: Just look at those little children, and if anybody can even think about legalizing drugs, they've lost me.

Text: We then realized there were multiple items sharing the identical serial number.
examples: And then we noticed that there was more than one with that same serial number.

Text: Such changes would transform the American education system and elevate our economic standing to the highest level.
examples: Those things would revolutionize American education and take us to the top economically.

Text: Oscar, one major distinction between Senator Dole and me is our stance on what actions the federal government should take to restrict young people's access to tobacco.
examples: Oscar, the question of what the federal government should do to limit the access of tobacco to young people is one of the biggest differences between Senator Dole and me.

Text: After hearing both arguments, I believe that if people would communicate instead of attacking each other, we could achieve significant progress.
examples: Well, I've listened to both sides, and if they would talk to one another instead of throwing rocks, I think we could get a lot done.

Text: Our nation is struggling due to poor decisions regarding employment and current affairs made by people like Secretary Clinton.
examples: Our country is suffering because people like Secretary Clinton have made such bad decisions in terms of our jobs and in terms of what's going on.

Text: Allow me to correct an earlier statement that claimed food prices would increase by twenty-five percent under my agricultural plan.
examples: Well first may I correct a statement which was made before, that under my agricultural program food prices would go up twenty-five percent.

Text: Much like Mr. Perot, I am worried about the deficits; $150 billion is a significant amount, but it's challenging to commit to more spending while we aim to reduce the deficit.
examples: Like Mr. Perot, I am concerned about the deficits and $150 billion is a lot of money, but it's awful hard to say we're going to go out and spend more money when we're trying to get the deficit down.

Text: I've had a 35-year acquaintance with him.
examples: I've known him for 35 years.

Text: In my opinion, the President of the United States holds no greater responsibility than ensuring the safety of the American people.
examples: Look, this, in my view, is the highest responsibility of the President of the United States, which is to maintain the safety of the American people.

Text: They understand the experience of lacking family leave or childcare.
examples: They know what it's like not to have family leave or childcare.

Text: I envision a future where global peace prevails, led by the United States of America advocating for democracy, human rights, and freedom worldwide.
examples: I see a future when the world is at peace, with the United States of America promoting the values of democracy and human rights and freedom all around the world.

Text: Nobody else thinks that is true.
examples: No one else believes that's the case.

Text: In terms of personal differences, Jim, more detail might help, but I believe the President could clarify the issue of pardons tonight.
examples: Getting back to personal differences, I think, Jim, if you are a little more specific, but I think the President could clarify one thing tonight and that's the question of pardons.

Text: I trust that the Senate will fulfill its duty by confirming President Obama's nominee.
examples: I would hope that the Senate would do its job and confirm the nominee that President Obama has sent to them.

Text: There's no way I'm telling him that he'll have more leeway after the election.
examples: And I'm certainly not going to say to him, I'll give you more flexibility after the election.

Text: Donald Trump operates like a small enterprise.
examples: Donald Trump is a small business.

Text: I firmly believe in the necessity of standing up and fighting regardless of the influential forces opposing you.
examples: I believe very deeply that you have to be willing to stand up and fight no matter what powerful forces might be on the other side.

examples: Another is to pass -- to get our seniors to sign up to these drug discount cards, and they're working.

examples: And we're doing just that.

Text: The challenge will be greater, as we're dealing with highly intricate and challenging topics.
examples: It's going to be a little tougher because we're talking about very complex and difficult issues.

Text: In truth, I believe Senator McCain and I are largely in agreement on these matters.
examples: No, actually, I think Senator McCain and I agree for the most part on these issues.

Text: Our strategy involves making investments in preventive measures.
examples: And we're going to do it by investing in prevention.

Text: I firmly believe that our education system should begin with preschool and continue through college.
examples: I feel strongly that we have to have an education system that starts with preschool and goes through college.

Text: It requires assistance and needs to be rectified.
examples: It has to be helped, has to be fixed.

examples: And the world is better off without him in power.
